meanings.sent1: Be careful not to overboil the pasta or it will become mushy.
meanings.sent2: I tend to overboil my eggs, making them hard to peel.
meanings.sent3: She always manages to overboil the vegetables, turning them into a soggy mess.
meanings.sent4: The pot on the stove seemed to overboil with excitement, bubbling over the edges.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pot overboiling stuck in my mind, reminding me to watch it closely next time.

meanings.sent1: The soup was overboil hot, burning my tongue with each sip.
meanings.sent2: She stirred the pot overboil, causing the liquid to spill over the sides.
meanings.sent3: The water in the kettle was overboil, creating a loud hissing sound.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the kitchen was overboil, with everyone rushing around.
meanings.sent5: The steam rose overboil from the pot, clouding the air with warmth.
